Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course if your chain wants to use the legacy version, then you cant expect to be having the latest

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: any chain that doesnt want to update, should let us know and we will make the appropriate provisions for those chains

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: So then we would have people running the updated software and some running the old software. I don't see this as a scalable solution. Given the platform is growing. Each time Komodo updates it halts the other chains too or they face forking, maintaining their own code base, or worse.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Right now yes, it doesn't matter. We have less than 10 chains that are trading

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: But when we have 500-1000 chains, this would be more chaos.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well, we dont expect another sapling level update, so it can be the normal annual cycle

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the key is we are solving todays issues today

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: No, but surely there will be other forks. As there were last year.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: We need to think of a better way to keep everyone updated

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well if there is a need for a fork, there is a need for a fork and not having to make any source level changes vs having to make them, it seems the latter is more work

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: having software that never needs to be updated is likely not a reality for some years

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and automatically updating is a worse "solution" as it creates a monster attack vector

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: I've looked at several other networks and when they update, their tokens or sidechains don't usually halt. What I'm pointing out is a flaw in the he scalability of the assetchain in the longterm.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: let us not assume that in the future we will use the same methods as now

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also, the assetchains dont have to update. they wont halt if they dont

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: plz dont make a problem when there isnt one

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also if there is a hardfork and you dont update, then any tokens on the old fork indeed have a problem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: being an independent chain creates more flexibility in the update process than if it was a token on the main chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not that a token on the main chain is directly comparable to having its own chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if you have your own chain, you have your own chain, with all that means

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: including the need for updating at times

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Maybe that solution will be more scalable: "let us not assume that in the future we will use the same methods as now"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a key point you seem to be missing is that assetchains that choose to not update, wont have to update anything on the exchanges

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the new codebase using -ac_sapling=farfutureheight is interoperable with the old version. So not sure why you claim this isnt scalable

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: I claim it isn't scalable because what we have to do to update chainzilla has to be done to all chains if we want to be on the latest update.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: So the amount of work we are doing times 1000x or however many chains we will have in 1-2 years. It's not scalable unless you expect each token to have a dedicated team to do all the manual work to update. it's not something companies want to hear.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there wont be any regular sapling level updates

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: not sure what your point is

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there needs to be at least an annual update for new notaries

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is just a matter to update the daemon, and not the entire infrastructure

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: How many hardforks did we have this year non-sapling related

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: what are the changes that a chain needs to themselves to update?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to get the new version, you need to get the new version

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you dont, you wont have the new version

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yet, we have provision for the new version to be backward compatible with the old version

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: still you are complaining about a "problem" that seems is not a real problem now

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: i guess i'll stop complaining then

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: üôÑ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I try to make the process as smooth as possible and think I achieved that this time.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you have chains that dont want to update, let us know

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: the code is bening prepared along with Aagama wallet, notary nodes, spv servers, explorers. all an assetchain user has to do is use the latest version. if the chain is in exchange, the exchange has to update komodo daemon. if the assetchain is in an exchange with KMD, it is already being updated. all the exchange has to do is restart the chain after the daemon update

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: I dont know anyone that wants to run an outdated chain .

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: but if we do, i'll surely let you know

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if they dont want to update, then we just need to add -ac_sapling=farfutureheight and then the new will interop with the old and nobody is forced to update
